comment.author: 92581505@N02
comment._content: If you look very carefully you can make out the 'Old Mill', (or Shenton's Mill) across the water on the spit. As a guide, look at the left most mast on the double masted boat. Follow that mast to its tip, and look just to the left of it, there you will see the white shape of the mill. This Mill is one of Perth's oldest remaining buildings, built in 1835 just 6 years after the arrival of the first settlers. It has been restored and well perserved by the city of South Perth, and is now clearly visible from the Mitchell Freeway which was actually diverted slightly to preserve the Mill. For more information you can always start with the wikipedia article: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Mill,_Perth
